t: A Psalm{H4210} of Asaph{H623}. God{H430} standeth{H5324}{H8737)} in the congregation{H5712} of the mighty{H410}; he judgeth{H8199}{H8799)} among{H7130} the gods{H430}.
How long will ye judge{H8199}{H8799)} unjustly{H5766}, and accept{H5375}{H8799)} the persons{H6440} of the wicked{H7563}? Selah{H5542}.
Defend{H8199}{H8798)} the poor{H1800} and fatherless{H3490}: do justice{H6663}{H8685)} to the afflicted{H6041} and needy{H7326}{H8802)}.
Deliver{H6403}{H8761)} the poor{H1800} and needy{H34}: rid{H5337}{H8685)} them out of the hand{H3027} of the wicked{H7563}.

They know{H3045}{H8804)} not, neither will they understand{H995}{H8799)}; they walk{H1980}{H8691)} on in darkness{H2825}: all the foundations{H4144} of the earth{H776} are out of course{H4131}{H8735)}.
I have said{H559}{H8804)}, Ye are gods{H430}; and all of you are children{H1121} of the most High{H5945}.
But{H403} ye shall die{H4191}{H8799)} like men{H120}, and fall{H5307}{H8799)} like one{H259} of the princes{H8269}.
Arise{H6965}{H8798)}, O God{H430}, judge{H8199}{H8798)} the earth{H776}: for thou shalt inherit{H5157}{H8799)} all nations{H1471}.
